sen.j: 藤原 保昌（ふじわら の やすまさ、天徳 (日本)2年（958年） - 長元9年（1036年））は、平安時代中期の公家。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yasumasa (958-1036) was a courtier during the middle of the Heian Period.

sen.e: He is also called Hirai Yasumasa because he lived in Hirai, Settsu Province when he was the governor.

sen.j: 長和2年（1013年）に左馬権頭兼大和国守に任じられ､以後円融天皇判官代・丹後国守・摂津国守・山城国守・肥前国守・日向国守などを歴任し正四位下に昇る。
sen.e: In 1013, he was appointed Sama no gon no kami (Provisional Captain of Samaryo, Left Division of Bureau of Horses) and Yamato Province governor and later was hogandai (an administrative official of the Retired-Emperor's Office) for Emperor Enu, Tango, Settsu, Yamashiro, Higo, Hyuga Province governor and climbed to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.e: A captain of a robber group called Hakamadare wanted to rob him of his costume and followed him, but was too scared to actually rob him.

sen.e: In later years, Hakamadare was thought to be the same as Yasumasa's brother FUJIWARA no Yasusuke and was called "Hakamadare Yasusuke", but the story in Konjyaku monogatari is logically difficult to consider as a story between brothers and therefore Hakamadare and FUJIWARA no Yasusuke are thought to be different people.
